intro: Malcolmia naxensis, commonly known as the Cyprus carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Cyprus. It is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Malcolmia naxensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
